nodes.bodyText: I feel like "Random" shouldn't be part of the name here, as it might be an implementation detail. I would rather go with something like getEquipmentEnchantedWith, while keeping the new javadocs.
how about getRandom -> choose?
Renamed. The new name is chooseEquipmentWith
Similarly, this could be renamed to getEquipmentEnchantedWith

nodes.bodyText: Perhaps use the singular EnchantmentEntry instead?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_1889 net/minecraft/enchantment/EnchantmentsEntry

nodes.bodyText: enchantments refers to the nbt list Enchantments or StoredEnchantments. This object is part of that list rather than part of the current Enchantment we have, so I named it with an s.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@

nodes.bodyText: Done, thanks earth!
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_1889 net/minecraft/enchantment/EnchantmentsEntry

nodes.bodyText: I don't think defining immutability has anything to do with hashCode and equals.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@ +CLASS net/minecraft/class_1889 net/minecraft/enchantment/EnchantmentLevelEntry + COMMENT Represents an entry in an enchantments array, i.e. a pair between + COMMENT enchantment and level. This is also a weighted entry and is available + COMMENT for the weighted picker to pick from a list. + COMMENT + COMMENT

This is usually used where multiple enchantment to level mappings can + COMMENT exist, such as in enchanting logic. In other cases, vanilla prefers + COMMENT {@code Map} over {@code List}. + COMMENT + COMMENT

This class, though effectively immutable, does not override hashCode + COMMENT or equals.

nodes.bodyText: Well, hashCode and equals are unreliable if an object isn't immutbale, i.e. immutability is a prerequisite for useful hashCode/equals
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@ +CLASS net/minecraft/class_1889 net/minecraft/enchantment/EnchantmentLevelEntry + COMMENT Represents an entry in an enchantments array, i.e. a pair between + COMMENT enchantment and level. This is also a weighted entry and is available + COMMENT for the weighted picker to pick from a list. + COMMENT + COMMENT

This is usually used where multiple enchantment to level mappings can + COMMENT exist, such as in enchanting logic. In other cases, vanilla prefers + COMMENT {@code Map} over {@code List}. + COMMENT + COMMENT

This class, though effectively immutable, does not override hashCode + COMMENT or equals.

nodes.bodyText: If you use "find", I'd call it findRandom (see java stream), which... I like choose better
find fails to indicate the random aspect of this method, while choose can have null result if none of the options can be chosen.
If you want to look at java streams, you could call it findAny, it has basically the same behaviour.
Java's stream findAny is more like entity selector's sort=arbitrary, while this method behaves like sort=random

This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters Suggested change COMMENT

For enchanted books, it retrieves from the item stack's stored than COMMENT regular enchantments. COMMENT

For enchanted books, it retrieves from the stack's stored enchantments COMMENT rather than from the regular enchantments data. COMMENT @see EnchantedBookItem#getEnchantmentTag
